0.title: Ex-Barcelona footballer Prince marries Italian model on Moon in metaverse, pics surface
0.article_body: Former Barcelona footballer Kevin Prince Boateng, commonly known as Prince, married Italian model Valentina Fradegrada on Moon in the metaverse. "I wanted to do something special for Valentina, something that nobody had ever done. Thanks to OVER, we can celebrate our love like no one has done before, in a space location," Prince had earlier said.

1.title: US-based electric scooter startup fires 23% of its employees
1.article_body: US-based electric scooter startup Bird has fired 23% of its employees. Bird reportedly told a website that it has a headcount of about 600 people, meaning almost 140 employees will be affected. The layoffs will range from senior managers to new hires, said a Bird spokesperson. In 2020, Bird had fired 30% of its workforce on a Zoom call.

2.title: Chemical thrown on woman allegedly raped by Raj minister's son, told to drop case: DCW
2.article_body: The 23-year-old woman who had accused Rajasthan minister Mahesh Joshi's son of rape in Jaipur and Delhi was attacked with a chemical by some "unidentified persons", the Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) told police. "They...threatened her to withdraw her rape case," said DCW. The woman alleged that the accused persons told her 'This is just a trailer', during the attack.

3.title: Names, addresses asked before killing, how to live safely: Kashmiri Pandit
3.article_body:
While talking about the recent killings in Kashmir, a Kashmiri Pandit, as quoted by The Quint, said,
"We have seen minority killings earlier too, but this time, militancy has taken the form of targeted killings. They ask for names and addresses before killing. How can we live safely there?" He added he fears to be killed while sitting in office.

4.title: Binny Bansal sells 0.72% stake in Flipkart worth ₹2,060 crore to Tencent: Report
4.article_body: Flipkart Co-founder Binny Bansal has sold a 0.72% stake in Flipkart to China-based tech conglomerate Tencent through its European subsidiary, PTI reported citing official documents. The stake is valued at $264 million (over ₹2,060 crore) as per Flipkart's last valuation of $37.6 billion. The transaction was reportedly completed last year, and disclosed to the government in current financial year.

5.title: BA.5 sub-variant of Omicron detected in 37-year-old man in Pune
5.article_body: A 37-year-old man from Pune has tested positive for BA.5 sub-variant of Omicron. The man has been fully vaccinated and he returned from England on May 21. "The patient, who had mild symptoms, was diagnosed with COVID-19 on June 2 and cured after being in home isolation," Maharashtra surveillance officer Dr Pradeep Awate has said.

6.title: Man going to Golden Temple with family shot dead in Amritsar
6.article_body: A man was allegedly shot dead in Punjab's Amritsar on Sunday while he was going to visit the Golden Temple with his wife and two children. The victim, identified as Harinder Singh, had returned from Dubai, where he worked, just five days ago. His wife said that the attackers tried to snatch their valuables which led to a scuffle.

7.title: Sonia Gandhi hospitalised in Delhi over COVID-related issues
7.article_body: Congress' interim President Sonia Gandhi has been admitted to Sir Ganga Ram Hospital in Delhi due to issues related to COVID-19, party spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala said. "She's stable and will be kept at the hospital for observation," he added. Earlier, the Enforcement Directorate had issued fresh summons to Sonia Gandhi to appear before it for questioning on June 23.

8.title: Crypto market value declines to $1.1 trillion as Bitcoin drops to $27,000 level
8.article_body: The value of global crypto market declined more than 8% to $1.1 trillion as major cryptocurrencies traded in the red on Sunday. Bitcoin, the largest crypto by market value, fell 6.29% to $27,454, whereas Ethereum plunged as low as $1,450, its lowest level since March 2021. The decline comes after US inflation hit a 40-year high of 8.6% in May.

9.title: Hardik can score 70-80 in 30 balls, send him ahead of Pant: Chopra
9.article_body: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra has said that all-rounder Hardik Pandya has the ability to score 70-80 runs off 30 deliveries. "I feel you should send Hardik...whenever a wicket falls after the 10th-12th over," Chopra said. "If you give Hardik 30 balls...he is going to give you a 70 or 80...You can send him ahead of Rishabh Pant," Chopra added.

10.title: It's just unbelievable what Rafael Nadal has achieved: Roger Federer
10.article_body: Tennis player Roger Federer praised Rafael Nadal after the latter won the 14th French Open title.  "It's just unbelievable what Rafa has achieved. The record of Pete Sampras, which I beat, was 14 Grand Slam titles. Now Rafa has won the French Open 14 times," Federer stated. "I was happy for him that he did it again," he added.

11.title: Philippine Defense Secretary faints during Independence Day event
11.article_body: Philippine Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana on Sunday morning fainted during an Independence Day ceremony at Rizal Park. He later shared a picture of himself at a hospital saying, "My lack of rest and sleep from my recent...international security engagements may have taken its toll...I'm fine now." Delfin was advised to rest following the incident, Defense spokesperson Arsenio Andolong said.

12.title: Stuart Broad shares pic of major fire at his pub, says 'Not sure I still can believe it'
12.article_body: England fast bowler Stuart Broad took to Instagram to share picture of major fire at his pub. He wrote, "I couldn’t believe the news...Not sure I still can." He added, "Thankfully no one was hurt, the Nottinghamshire Fire Service were incredible in their efforts & thank you to the villagers for the wonderful support & sorry for the disruption."

13.title: AAP announces new Gujarat unit, Kishorbhai Desai named state chief
13.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Sunday announced the new office-bearers for its Gujarat unit. Kishorbhai Desai has been named as the State President, while Manoj Sorathiya has been appointed as State General Secretary. The party also appointed Gujarat leader Isudan Gadhvi as the National Joint General Secretary and Indranil Rajguru as the National Joint Secretary.

14.title: Demolition of 'illegally constructed' house of Prayagraj violence accused underway
14.article_body: Demolition of the "illegally constructed" residence of Prayagraj violence accused Javed Ahmed is underway. The move came after Prayagraj Development Authority (PDA) earlier put a demolition notice at the residence. News agency ANI reported that heavy security force has been deployed in front of Ahmed's residence. The PDA had asked him to vacate the house by 11 am today.

15.title: That was an unbelievable knock by Dasun Shanaka: Aaron Finch
15.article_body: After Sri Lanka chased down 59 runs in the last three overs in the third T20I, Australia captain Aaron Finch praised Sri Lanka skipper Dasun Shanaka's knock. "That was an unbelievable knock by Dasun tonight...I don't think our choice of batting first today had any reason for the defeat," he stated. Dasun smashed 25-ball 54 runs in the match.

16.title: Ready to play for Eng Test side if McCullum wants me in it: Moeen Ali
16.article_body: English all-rounder Moeen Ali has opened up to the idea of coming out of retirement from Test cricket and represent the English Test side. "When, or if, (England head coach) Brendon McCullum wants me, I'll play in Pakistan. I have played Pakistan Super League out there a few years ago," Ali said. Notably, England will tour Pakistan in November-December 2022.

17.title: UP groom leaves mandap for drinking water, runs from wedding over no dowry
17.article_body: A groom who was getting married among 144 couples in a mass-wedding event ran away from the wedding after he did not get dowry he wanted, reports said. Reports added that the groom had left the 'mandap' on pretext of going to drink water. When he did not return, massive search was reportedly initiated but he could not be traced.

18.title: Stop wearing 'I work long hrs, have no time for family' as a badge of honour: Namita
18.article_body: Emcure Pharmaceuticals' Executive Director and Shark Tank India judge Namita Thapar took to Twitter to talk about work-life balance. She wrote, "Stop wearing 'I work long hours, I travel a lot, I have no time for family' as a badge of honour. Let's fix work-life balance at all companies so we have a mentally fit and more productive generation next."

19.title: Hardik extremely versatile, you can play him at no. 4 and no. 6 as well: Bangar
19.article_body: Ex-India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has called all-rounder Hardik Pandya an "extremely versatile" player, who can be used in multiple roles by the team. "Hardik has worked very well on his game's foundation. You can play him at number four and at number six as well," Bangar added. Hardik scored 31*(12) in the first T20I against South Africa.

20.title: Woman attacked with blade for resisting eve-teasing in Bhopal, gets 118 stitches on face
20.article_body: A 32-year-old woman was attacked with a blade for resisting eve-teasing by three men and slapping one of them in Bhopal which led to 118 stitches on her face. The woman's one eye is not opening and she's not even able to speak, police said. Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said stringent action will be taken against the accused.

21.title: Rebranded McDonald's outlets open in Russia, renamed 'Vkusno & tochka'
21.article_body: The first 15 rebranded restaurants of former McDonald's reopened in Russia on Sunday under the name 'Vkusno & tochka', which means "Tasty & that's it". The new owner had recently unveiled their logo which featured two french fries and a burger. In May, McDonald's shut its business in Russia after 30 years of operation over the Ukraine war.

22.title: B'luru records 87% rise in new COVID-19 cases in 7 days with 545 cases
22.article_body: The number of new COVID-19 cases recorded in Bengaluru rose by about 87% in the last seven days as 545 new cases were reported on Saturday, according to BBMP data. The city had recorded 291 new cases on June 5. Only one COVID-19 death was recorded during the period and the total active clusters remained above 10, the data showed.

23.title: 'More transmissible' Omicron BA.4 COVID-19 variant detected in Russia
23.article_body: The Omicron BA.4 variant of COVID-19 has been detected in Russia, the country's health watchdog Rospotrebnadzor's genome lab head Kamil Khafizov said. "A number of studies published recently have revealed that variants...BA.4 and BA.5 are a little bit more transmissible than...early forms of Omicron," he said. Currently, BA.2 variant and its sub-variant are dominant in the country, he added.

24.title: Don't want to close door to China, willing to engage: Taiwan
24.article_body: Taiwan Premier Su Tseng-chang has said the country has always had goodwill towards China. "As long as there is equality, reciprocity and no political preconditions, we are willing to engage in goodwill with China," he said. "Taiwan does not want to close the door to China," he added. He blamed China for using "means to oppress and treat Taiwan unreasonably".

25.title: Prominent leader of Shiv Sena to attend Oppn leaders’ meeting: Raut
25.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said a prominent leader of the party will take part in Opposition leaders’ meeting called by West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, on June 15, instead of Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray. The decision comes as the CM will be in Ayodhya at that time, Raut stated. The meeting has been scheduled ahead of the Presidential poll.

26.title: One of the best T20I finishes, that was brutal hitting by Shanaka: Malinga
26.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka pacer Lasith Malinga has praised Dasun Shanaka for his unbeaten 54-run innings against Australia in their third T20I in Pallekele. "One of the best T20I finishes I've ever witnessed. That was some brutal hitting [by Shanaka]," tweeted Malinga. Shanaka's knock helped Sri Lanka to chase down 59 runs in the last three overs and win by four wickets.

27.title: Cong, JD(S) have accepted BJP as 'A' team: Karnataka CM
27.article_body: After BJP won three out of four Rajya Sabha seats from Karnataka on Friday, CM Basavaraj Bommai has spoken about the opposition parties namely JD(S) and Congress. "We are not bothered as to who is the 'B' team...It means both the opposition parties have accepted that BJP is the 'A' team," CM Bommai said.

28.title: Won't outstay my welcome as England manager: Gareth Southgate
28.article_body: England head coach Gareth Southgate has said that he will not outstay his welcome as the football team's manager. "I think I can do a good job for the team, and...we have done a good job for the team," he stated. Southgate signed a contract extension in November last year and will remain England manager till 2024 end.

29.title: Power supply gets disrupted in Nepal after man climbs onto transmission line
29.article_body: Electricity production in Nepal's Nuwakot's hydro-electric plant was disrupted after a person climbed onto a power transmission line and has been clinging to it. The state electricity authority, Nepal Electricity Authority (NEA) was forced to shut down the power project. As per an NEA official, an average loss of around one million Nepalese Rupees has been incurred due to this.

30.title: Death knell for rule of law: Karti after buildings bulldozed in UP
30.article_body: After buildings of those accused of violence during protests over remarks on Prophet Muhammad were demolished in Kanpur and Saharanpur, Congress’ Karti Chidambaram said state-sponsored vigilante justice is the "death knell" for the rule of law. In Kanpur, parts of a building owned by businessman Mohammad Ishtiyaq, a relative of 'key conspirator' Hayat Zafar Hashmi, were demolished.

31.title: I would want South Africa to drop David Miller, jokes Bhuvneshwar Kumar ahead of 2nd T20I
31.article_body: Ahead of the second India-South Africa T20I, pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar said, "It is difficult bowling to David Miller." He added, "He is in such good form. I would want South Africa to drop him but they would not do so." Bhuvneshwar stated, "He batted so well in the IPL, we know his calibre. Bowling to him would be a challenge."

32.title: Salman joins Kamal, Chiranjeevi at Vikram success party, pics surface
32.article_body: Pictures of actor Salman Khan with actors Kamal Haasan and Chiranjeevi at the success party of the film 'Vikram' have surfaced on social media. Chiranjeevi took to Twitter and shared the pictures and wrote, "Absolute joy, celebrating and honouring my dearest old friend Kamal for the spectacular success of 'Vikram' along with my dearest Sallu Bhai."

33.title: R Madhavan’s Rocketry trailer launched at Times Square, actor shares video
33.article_body: The trailer of actor R Madhavan's film 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' was screened at the NASDAQ Billboard at Times Square in New York. The actor took to Instagram and shared a video of the crowd at Times Square. The film is written, produced and directed by Madhavan, who also plays the lead role.

34.title: Trent Boult equals world record for scoring most runs at no. 11 in Test cricket
34.article_body: New Zealand pacer Trent Boult equalled the world record for scoring the most runs batting at number 11 in Test cricket. With his 16*(18), Boult took his tally of Test runs at number 11 to 623. He equalled former Sri Lanka off-spinner Muttiah Muralitharan's record. Boult scored 623 runs in 78 innings, while Muralitharan scored in 98 innings.

35.title: 19 lakh+ devotees undertook Char Dham Yatra since May 3: Temple Committee
35.article_body: The Badrinath-Kedarnath Temple Committee said that since the Char Dham Yatra began on May 3, over 19 lakh devotees have undertaken the journey. Reports said that 6,57,547 pilgrims reached Badrinath Dham From May 8 to June 11 evening, while 6,33,548 pilgrims have reached the Kedarnath Dham from May 6 to June 11 evening.

36.title: India hands over 50-bed hospital in Bokhtar to Tajikistan
36.article_body: India's Ambassador to Tajikistan Viraj Singh on Saturday handed over the 50-bed India-Tajikistan Friendship Hospital (ITFH) in Bokhtar to the Tajik Deputy Defence Minister Major General Shohiyon Abdusottor. The medical equipment, medicines, stores and support equipment were also handed over, a press release said. The ITFH, which was renovated by the Indian government, was inaugurated in 2014.

37.title: Thousands stage protests against gun violence across US
37.article_body: Tens of thousands of people took out rallies across the US demanding a law to curb gun violence in the country. This comes in the wake of a spate of mass shootings across the country including the Texas school shooting incident. A group called March For Our Lives (MFOL) estimated that about 40,000 people assembled in the capital Washington DC.

38.title: Ukraine in control of Luhansk plant sheltering hundreds, claims Guv
38.article_body: Ukraine is in control of a chemical plant in Luhansk's Sievierodonetsk where hundreds of people are sheltering, the region's Governor Serhiy Gaidai claimed. As per Ukraine authorities, about 800 people are hiding there. Moreover, Gaidai said that information about a blockade at the plant is a "lie" after a Russian-backed Luhansk official stated that 300-400 Ukrainian troops were blockaded there.

39.title: AIMIM will contest this year's Gujarat Assembly elections: Owaisi
39.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi announced at a press conference on Saturday that his party will contest in the Gujarat Assembly elections scheduled to be held later this year. "We will fight Gujarat Assembly elections with full strength. However, we haven't decided on how many seats. I believe that Sabir Kabliwala (AIMIM Gujarat chief) will make the right decision," Owaisi said.

40.title: In a world first, Canada proposes to print health warnings on every cigarette
40.article_body: Canada is poised to become the first country in the world to require health warnings to be printed on individual cigarettes. Mental Health and Addictions Minister said the current proposal is "Poison in every puff". The new packaging would help to ensure health-related messages reach people who often access cigarettes one at a time in social situations, the government said.

41.title: Hand grenade found near Delhi-Noida Direct flyway, area cordoned off
41.article_body: A hand grenade was reportedly found near the Delhi-Noida Direct flyway on Saturday. Reports said that youths bathing in the Yamuna informed police about a sack with hand grenade. The whole area was reportedly cordoned off to avoid any untoward incident. "There are a few shops of scrap dealers in the adjoining areas. We are questioning them," an official said.

42.title: Good that people who misuse freedom of speech are sent to jail: Shekhar
42.article_body: Shekhar Suman has said, "People who misuse freedom of speech, it is good that they are sent to jail." He added that people cracking jokes on religion can't get away by saying that it is their freedom of speech. "Freedom comes with responsibility and if you can't take that responsibility then you will have to go to jail," he added.

43.title: Idea is to return to top-level tennis in 2023: Roger Federer
43.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer has said that he is "definitely" planning to return to top-level tennis in 2023. "How and where, I don't know yet. But that would be the idea (to return next year)," Federer told a newspaper. He added, "It's just unbelievable what Rafa has achieved...Now Rafa won the French Open 14 times. That's unbelievable."

44.title: This was small battle, big one still left: Fadnavis on RS poll results
44.article_body: After BJP won three out of six Rajya Sabha seats in Maharashtra, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said this was a small battle, the big one is still left. "We didn’t get afraid even when state government lodged cases against those who supported us," Fadnavis added. "We're very happy that all our three candidates…have been elected to Rajya Sabha," he stated.

45.title: Double-hundred doesn't mean a hell of a lot: Daryl Mitchell on getting out on 190
45.article_body: New Zealand's Daryl Mitchell has said he doesn't regret getting dismissed for 190(318) during their first innings in the second England Test. "A double-hundred personally doesn't mean a hell of a lot...was just nice to contribute to a score that can help us win," he stated. Mitchell and Tom Blundell added 236 runs to help New Zealand post 553 runs.

46.title: Global star rising, you'll have to learn how to spell his name: Mahindra on Praggnanandhaa
46.article_body: After India's 16-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa won the Norway Chess Group A open chess tournament, Anand Mahindra tweeted, "A global star is rising." He added, "You’ll have to learn how to spell his name correctly from now on." Notably, Praggnanandhaa has defeated world champion Magnus Carlsen twice this year.

47.title: In its core, 'Brahmastra Part One' is also love story: Ayan Mukerji
47.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji said a love story is there to talk about in his film 'Brahmastra'. "The thing about 'Brahmastra' is that you won't realise right away but I hope you'll take away is...in its core, 'Brahmastra Part One' is also a love story amongst being...other things," he stated. "That's a very natural...nice fit with Ranbir Kapoor...Alia Bhatt," he added.

48.title: 4 arrested by Faridabad Police for assaulting, robbing commuters
48.article_body: Four members of a gang were arrested by the Faridabad Police for allegedly abducting, assaulting and robbing commuters in the city. The accused were arrested from Faridabad's Patel Chowk with the help of a tip-off. The accused had already robbed several commuters of ₹10 lakh, police said. The accused were identified as Vikas Kumar, Gajraj, Vishal and Vicky.

49.title: Apple to shift some iPad production units from China to Vietnam amid COVID-19 norms
49.article_body: After facing supply disruptions due to COVID-19 restrictions, Apple is moving some iPad production units from China to Vietnam. To protect itself from future shortages and supply issues, Apple has reportedly asked multiple component suppliers to build up their inventories. Plans of shifting units to Vietnam were earlier delayed due to a surge in COVID-19 cases in Vietnam.

50.title: BCCI will get paid at least ₹93 crore per IPL match from media rights: Jay Shah
50.article_body: Talking about the e-auction of media rights for IPL for 2023-2027 cycle, BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said, "Going by the present minimum base price that we have set, BCCI will get paid $12 million (nearly ₹93 crore) per IPL match." He added, "That’s a giant leap for Indian cricket on the world stage. We will be just behind NFL."

51.title: It doesn't bother me, I know my truth: Jennifer on link-up rumours with Tanuj
51.article_body: While talking about link-up rumours with her 'Code M' co-star Tanuj Virwani, actress Jennifer Winget said that it does not bother her. "As long as I know my truth, my family knows the truth, my friends and fans know my truth, that's all that matters to me," she added. Winget had earlier spoken about her separation with actor Karan Grover.

52.title: No change in XI required unless wicket is dry: Gambhir on India-SA 2nd T20I
52.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir has said no change is required in India's playing XI for the second T20I against South Africa unless the wicket is "extremely dry". Gambhir added, "[If the wicket is dry]...you can sit out a seamer and play the leg-spinner in Bishnoi and Hardik can be your third seamer." India lost the first T20I by seven wickets.

53.title: UP CM seems to be presiding over kangaroo court: Mehbooba Mufti
53.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said UP CM Yogi Adityanath seems to be presiding over a "kangaroo court" where minorities are bulldozed on a regular basis. Her statement came after buildings of those accused of violence during recent protests were demolished in Kanpur and Saharanpur. "Unfortunately, judiciary watches in silence as homes and lives are wrecked," Mufti tweeted.

54.title: 2 more terrorists linked to Lashkar-e-Taiba killed in J&K's Pulwama
54.article_body: Two more terrorists were killed in a counter-terrorism operation in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama, the police said on Sunday. This comes a day after one terrorist was killed there when the encounter broke out. All the three terrorists are linked to Lashkar-e-Taiba and one of them was involved in the killing of a police officer last month, the police added.

55.title: Hyd's theft racket busted, 53 2-wheelers worth ₹15,20,000 recovered; 3 held
55.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Saturday arrested three people for being involved in a theft racket. Police recovered 53 two-wheelers worth ₹15,20,000 from them. Reports said that the accused stole parked vehicles in the city during the wee hours and sold them in rural areas at lower prices. The accused reportedly told buyers they would receive legal documents of vehicles at earliest.

56.title: Sri Lanka open to buying oil from Russia, says PM Wickremesinghe
56.article_body: Amid the economic crisis, Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe said that he is open to buying oil from Russia. He said that the country desperately needs fuel and is currently trying to get oil and coal from suppliers in the Middle East. But if the requirement isn't fulfilled, the country may have to go to Russia again, he added.

57.title: Kerala gold smuggling accused collapses before media, says 'Kill me so story is over'
57.article_body: The prime accused in Kerala gold smuggling case, Swapna Suresh, collapsed while speaking to the media on Saturday, saying, "Hurt me, please kill me so that the story will get over." This comes after police registered a case against her lawyer over a Facebook post that allegedly hurt religious sentiments. Earlier, she alleged CM Pinarayi Vijayan's involvement in the case.

58.title: Hardik Pandya is going to be the game-changer for India: Gavaskar
58.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said that Hardik Pandya will be a game-changer for Team India, in not just the T20 World Cup, but in every T20I match India play. Gavaskar added that the all-round package in Hardik gives Team India options in selection. "Having him as a full-blown all-rounder is a key to the balance of India's team," Gavaskar stated.

59.title: Pune police bust prostitution racket run from spa; 4 girls rescued
59.article_body: Six people were arrested and four girls were rescued after police busted a prostitution racket following a raid at a spa in Pune's Koregaon Park. The spa allegedly ran the prostitution racket by charging customers more money for "extra services", according to the police. The raid was conducted on June 9, based on a tip-off received by the police.

60.title: 7 bodies found after helicopter crashes in Italy
60.article_body: The bodies of seven people were found two days after the helicopter they flew in crashed in Italy. The deceased included four Turkish, two Lebanese nationals and an Italian pilot. The helicopter took off from Lucca in Tuscany on Thursday and was headed to Treviso city. It reportedly got caught up in a storm and disappeared from the radar screens.

61.title: SL break world record against Australia, chase down most runs in final 3 overs of a T20
61.article_body: Sri Lanka defeated Australia by four wickets after chasing down 177-run target in third T20I in Pallekele. During their chase, Sri Lanka broke the world record for successfully chasing down most runs in final three overs of a T20. Sri Lanka chased down 59 runs in the last three overs, breaking Sydney Sixers' record of 56 runs against Sydney Thunder.

62.title: Ranbir Kapoor's 'Animal' has larger-than-life visuals: Producer
62.article_body: Producer Murad Khetani, speaking about Ranbir Kapoor's 'Animal', has said, "It's a challenging film." However, added that they have a "great team". "Sandeep Reddy Vanga (director) has written the story...he narrated it to Ranbir and Anil Kapoor, they liked it and agreed to come on board," he added. He added the film has action, emotion, heroism and "larger-than-life visuals".

63.title: IAS officer shares Class 10 marksheet of DM in Gujarat, says 'Got only passing marks'
63.article_body: IAS officer Awanish Saran took to Twitter to share Class 10 marksheet of Collector and DM of Gujarat's Bharuch district, saying "He got only passing marks in Class 10." Saran added, "He got 35 marks in English, 36 in Mathematics and 38 in Science...Not only in whole village but in his school it was said that he cannot do anything."

64.title: 318/4 reasons why I wouldn't think bowling first vs NZ wasn't right: Vaughan
64.article_body: Criticising England's fast bowling coach Jon Lewis for saying they took the right call in bowling first against New Zealand in the ongoing second Test, Vaughan tweeted, "318/4 reasons why I wouldn't think that's possibly correct." NZ had ended Day 1 at 318/4 before bundling out for 553 in their first innings. "We took the aggressive option," Lewis had said.

65.title: Delhi Police arrest 2 people in connection with Friday's Jama Masjid protest
65.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested two people under section 153A of IPC in connection with the protest that was held at Jama Masjid on Friday over remarks on Prophet made by suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma and expelled leader Naveen Jindal. "The way people came after offering namaz...with banners and placards...denotes that...there is some kind of planning behind it," police said.

66.title: Assam-based news channel's YouTube account hacked; Pak flag broadcast
66.article_body: Assam-based digital news channel 'TIME8' has said in a press release on Saturday that its YouTube account was hacked by a Pakistan-based group called 'Revolution PK' during a live stream. During the live stream, the Pakistan flag was broadcast along with 'Respect Holy Prophet (PBUH)' tickers, the press release stated. Reportedly, a hymn was also run in the background.

67.title: Starbucks CEO urges staff to return to office, says 'I'll get on my knees'
67.article_body: Starbucks CEO Howard Schultz at an event said that his employees are not coming back to the office "at the level" he wants. Schultz said, "I have been unsuccessful, despite everything I've tried to do, to get our people back to work…I've pleaded with them. I said I'll get on my knees. I'll do push-ups. Whatever you want. Come back."

68.title: RBL Bank appoints R Subramaniakumar as its new MD & CEO
68.article_body: RBL Bank has appointed R Subramaniakumar as its new MD and CEO for a period of three years. This comes nearly six months after RBL Bank's MD and CEO Vishwavir Ahuja stepped down. Subramaniakumar began his banking career with the state-run Punjab National Bank in 1980 and has previously served as administrator of Dewan Housing Finance Corporation Limited (DHFL).

69.title: Kerala CM should resign, face probe: Muraleedharan on gold smuggling case
69.article_body: Union Minister V Muraleedharan said Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan should resign and face the investigation, "if he has some morality left". His statement came following the allegation of CM's involvement in the Kerala gold smuggling case. "For the first time in history of this country, the CM has been accused of such a serious allegation of smuggling (gold)," Muraleedharan added.

70.title: Protest in Telangana's Adilabad over social media post, police use lathicharge
70.article_body: A protest reportedly erupted over a social media post in Telangana's Adilabad district. Police said that the accused, whose post triggered the protest, has been arrested. "We've registered a case under relevant sections of the IPC (Indian Penal Code) against one person...for hurting religious sentiments," police added. Reports said that police dispersed the crowd with use of batons.

71.title: BJP ready to use bulldozer model against those disturbing peace in K’taka: CT Ravi
71.article_body: BJP leader CT Ravi on Saturday said that the party is prepared to replicate the "bulldozer model" of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath against those who disturb communal harmony and peace in Karnataka. Furthermore, he said that a few political parties that have lost polls are trying to stir up unrest in the country.

72.title: 2 ragpickers die after entering into sewer in Delhi
72.article_body: Two ragpickers died after they entered a sewage tank in Delhi on Saturday, said police. The victims - 21-year-old Abdul Rehman and 22-year-old Ramzan - had entered the sewer to collect plastic waste. When the two did not come out, a third ragpicker entered the sewer. The two were then dragged out and were found in an unconscious state.

73.title: Rape lawsuit seeking ₹195 crore from Cristiano Ronaldo dismissed by US judge
73.article_body: A US judge has dismissed a 2018 Nevada lawsuit accusing Cristiano Ronaldo of rape in 2009 and requesting the Portuguese footballer pay the alleged victim more than ₹195 crore in damages. The judge said that the alleged victim's lawyer harmed Ronaldo by conducting himself in "bad faith" through repeated use of stolen, privileged documents to prosecute the case.

74.title: India sees over 8,000 new COVID-19 cases for 2nd day, active cases rise to 44,513
74.article_body: India has reported 8,582 COVID-19 cases, 4,435 recoveries, and four deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 8,329 COVID-19 cases and 10 deaths. Active cases in India increased to 44,513, while the death toll reached 5,24,761.

75.title: First Russian passports handed out to Ukrainians in occupied Kherson: Report
75.article_body: The Russian authorities have reportedly started handing out Russian passports to the Ukrainians living in the occupied city of Kherson for the first time. According to one of Russia's news agencies, 23 Kherson residents received Russian passports at a ceremony on Saturday. Kherson was one of the first cities that Russia conquered in the initial days of the war.

76.title: Man kills estranged wife's live-in partner in Delhi; arrested
76.article_body: A 32-year-old man, Robin, was arrested after he stabbed his estranged wife's live-in partner to death in Delhi, said police. The woman told the police that she was having a marital dispute and had been living with Kunal, the victim, for the last six months. She was going home with Kunal when Robin stabbed him several times, said police.

77.title: Ratan Tata receives honorary doctorate from Maharashtra's HSNC University
77.article_body: Tata Group Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata was presented with the Honorary Doctorate of Literature by Maharashtra's HSNC University, as a mark of appreciation for his contribution to society. The Governor of Maharashtra and the Chancellor of the university Bhagat Singh Koshyari presented the degree to Tata. "This means so much to me," said Tata during his acceptance speech.

78.title: 2 arrested for snatching gold chains from Gurugram's morning walkers
78.article_body: Two snatchers, who were part of a six-member gang that allegedly snatched gold chains from Gurugram's morning walkers, were arrested on Friday. The police recovered over 10 gold chains and two motorcycles from the accused's possession. Notably, the gang has over 100 cases registered against them in several areas including the Golf Course Road, Nirvana and Malibu Towne, police said.

79.title: Akshay sir said he's worked with most newcomers, I think I'm the 22nd: Manushi
79.article_body: Actress Manushi Chhillar said that actor Akshay Kumar told her he has worked with most newcomers in the industry. "So I think I'm the 22nd newcomer that Akshay sir has worked with," she said, adding, "For me, I couldn't have asked for a better launch because somewhere I knew that they [Akshay Kumar and Dr Chadraprakash Dwivedi] were so experienced."

80.title: India needs President who can protect Constitution: Congress
80.article_body: The Congress party is of the opinion that India needs a person as President who can protect the Constitution, our institutions and citizenry from the ongoing "onslaught" by the ruling party, Congress said. The statement comes as West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee called a meeting of the Opposition leaders, ahead of the election for the next President of India.

81.title: Pune Metro's revenue dips after 3 months as ridership falls
81.article_body: Pune Metro's revenue saw a decline in May as compared to March when the two lines - Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation to Phugewadi and Vanaz to Garware College - had started. While the revenue in March was ₹76,43,500, it was only ₹27,97,146 in May. The ridership number had surged massively after its launch on March 6, said an official.

82.title: B'luru's Singanayakanahalli lake project 'stalled' after criticism: Report
82.article_body: The forest department and the minor irrigation department have apparently stopped pursuing the development project of Bengaluru's Singanayakanahalli lake, The Indian Express reported. Last year, the authorities proposed to axe around 6,316 trees for the project. A senior forest official told The Indian Express, "There was a huge public outcry over axing trees. The project has stalled as of now."

83.title: Ex-Punjab MLA suffers ₹10 lakh loss as robbers steal 10 buffaloes from farm
83.article_body: Former Punjab MLA Tarsem Jodhan said that he has suffered a loss of ₹10 lakh as robbers stole 10 buffaloes from his farm. "They held my workers captive, while they loaded the stolen buffaloes in a vehicle," Jodhan said. A case under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code has been registered against the accused, police said.

84.title: Pant is a young captain, he'll improve as series progresses: Bhuvneshwar
84.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant's captaincy after India's defeat in the first T20I against South Africa, pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar said, "The captain is as good as the team and it's a team effort." He added, "Pant is a young captain and it was his first match. I'm sure he will try to do better and improve as the series progresses."

85.title: B'luru's Idgah Maidan should be preserved as public property: Hindu activist
85.article_body: Hindu activists have reportedly objected to Bengaluru's Idgah Maidan "being treated as property of minorities". Reports said Hindu organisations have decided to celebrate Yoga Day and Independence Day on site. "We will demand from CM Bommai...Idgah Maidan should be preserved as....public property and cultural activities of all religions must be permitted," Hindu activist, Pathapat Srinivas, said.

86.title: Wasn't what my role was supposed to be: Shilpa Shetty on 'Hungama 2'
86.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty said 'Hungama 2' wasn't supposed to be her comeback film. "I said yes to it because I can never say no to Ratan Jain (producer). He introduced...me in the industry," she stated. She added she always wanted to work with filmmaker Priyadarshan. "I saw the film and...felt...this wasn't what my role was supposed to be," she stated.

87.title: Bodies of 2 missing youths found in Pune's Vishrantwadi lake
87.article_body: The bodies of two missing youths, both aged 20, were recovered after villagers found them floating in Pune's Vishrantwadi lake, police officials said. "The youths were missing from June 6 and were found dead on Friday," investigators said. The deceased's families were called after the bodies were identified, following which the bodies were taken for post-mortem, according to police.

88.title: After 5 deaths, officials say K'taka filtration unit not cleaned for 5 yrs
88.article_body: As five people died after drinking contaminated water in Karnataka's Raichur, officials reportedly admitted several wards in city get untreated water. Reports said that officials admitted the filtration unit had not been cleaned or maintained for past five years. Raichur City Municipal Council Commissioner said junior engineer and assistant executive engineer have been suspended in the case.

89.title: Massive fire breaks out in Delhi's Gaffar market, 39 fire engines rushed to spot
89.article_body: A massive fire broke out in the Gaffar market in Delhi on Sunday. "A serious fire call was received from a shoe market in Gaffar, Karol Bagh, at 4:16 am and 39 fire tenders were rushed to the site," Delhi Fire Service Director Atul Garg said. The fire is under control and no one is trapped or injured, ANI reported.

90.title: Who are the 7 final bidders for ₹60,000-crore IPL broadcast rights?
90.article_body: The e-auction for IPL media rights for the next five-year cycle (2023 to 2027) will take place today. Disney-Star, Sony, Viacom-Reliance, Zee, Fun Asia, Super Sport and Times Internet are in the running. The number of bidders this time is half that of the previous auction. The cost to acquire the rights is estimated to be up to ₹60,000 crore.

91.title: 2 AirAsia Delhi-Srinagar flights face technical issues within hrs of each other
91.article_body: AirAsia India's two aircraft on Delhi to Srinagar route returned to the national capital after facing technical issues mid-air on the same day. While one flight took off from Delhi around 11.55 am, the technical issue was informed to passengers mid-air, half an hour later. The substitute aircraft also developed a similar issue and returned to Delhi around 5.30 pm.

92.title: 1 killed, 2 injured as under-construction building falls in Pune
92.article_body: A labourer was killed and two others were injured after an under-construction building collapsed in Pune's Kiwale village. The deceased labourer has been identified as 26-year-old Sandeep Balsingh from Jharkhand. "The construction workers were working at a site around 30 feet deep inside for a basement construction when a part of huge debris suddenly fell on them," said police.

93.title: I don't think we'll see Umran Malik playing in 2nd T20I vs SA: Jaffer
93.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said it's unlikely that pacer Umran Malik will make his India debut in the second T20I against South Africa. "It would be unfair to change the team after one game...Since it's a five-game series, there are always chances of getting opportunities later," he stated. India lost the first T20I by seven wickets.

94.title: Competed with Salman for 'Maine...', discussions were on to launch me: Deepak
94.article_body: Actor-Director Deepak Tijori said he and actor Salman Khan had auditioned for role of 'Prem' in the movie 'Maine Pyar Kia'. "Salman and I were only...people who were competing for the role of Prem, neck-to-neck...They had even told me that if they selected me...they'd like to change my name on...screen and discussed how they'd like to launch me," Tijori added.

95.title: Shaan said 'Don't come in big cars, come in autos, people will give work': Mika
95.article_body: Singer Mika Singh said that when he was new, singer Shaan had told him to not come in big cars "because one doesn't get work". "[He said] 'You simply come in autos...people will give you work'. I thought I had to change things...That a singer shouldn't only be seen in singing shows but should get opportunities everywhere," Mika added.

96.title: BJP will be in Guinness Book for paper leaks: Kejriwal in Himachal
96.article_body: Addressing a gathering at Himachal Pradesh's Hamirpur, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "The BJP government will be in the Guinness Book of World Records for paper leaks...during its rule." Kejriwal said, "I don't understand why papers are being leaked in Gujarat, Haryana and Himachal." He added, "Why doesn't it happen in our Delhi?"

97.title: We don't need Nupur Sharma's apology: Owaisi on Prophet remark row
97.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said there is no need to seek an apology from Nupur Sharma over her remarks on Prophet Muhammad since an FIR has been filed against her. "Law will take its own course," Owaisi said. Criticising Jharkhand's government over violence on Friday, he said, "There was firing on people in Ranchi, this shouldn't have happened."

98.title: Nadda meets envoys of 13 countries as part of 'Know BJP' initiative
98.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda interacted with envoys of 13 countries at the party headquarters in Delhi, where he informed them about the party's ideology, history and ongoing activities. This is the fourth such event held by the BJP President. The interaction was a part of the 'Know BJP' initiative which was launched on BJP's foundation day on April 6.

99.title: Strict action must be taken against hatemongers: Sachin Pilot
99.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot said strict action must be taken against those spreading hate in society. Reacting to comments over Prophet Muhammad, he said that the Centre wasn't bothered when people of the country demanded action against the spokesperson but was prompt in doing so when foreign countries issued denunciations. Pilot also criticised the Centre over rising inflation and unemployment.

100.title: 30 Army personnel named in chargesheet filed over death of civilians in Nagaland
100.article_body: Thirty Indian Army personnel have been named in the chargesheet filed in the connection to the botched security operation in Nagaland's Mon that led to the death of 13 civilians in December 2021. The personnel belonging to 21 Para Special Forces didn't follow the SOP and the Rules of Engagement and resorted to "indiscriminate and disproportionate firing", an SIT alleged.

101.title: Depp's fans criticise Amber for flying in private jet after lawyer said she can't pay $10mn
101.article_body: Actress Amber Heard was spotted for the first time since the verdict was announced in Johnny Depp's defamation trial. She was clicked stepping out of a private airplane. "If you can afford that, you can afford to pay what you owe Johnny," a tweet read. Her attorney had said she "absolutely cannot" pay the $10 million she owes Johnny now.

102.title: Sitharaman inaugurates GST museum installed in 400-yr-old building in Goa
102.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday inaugurated 'Dharohar', the National Museum of Customs and GST in Goa. The two-storey building is over 400 years old. It showcases artefacts seized by Indian Customs, including the manuscript of Ain-i-Akbari and replica of Amin pillars. It houses the 'Battle of Wits' gallery, showcasing the cerebral battle between smugglers and Customs officers.

103.title: Past decade saw increase in number of women voters: Book
103.article_body: The number of women voters in India has increased over the past decade, according to a new book released. Till 2010, the number of women voters was less than men, Sanjay Kumar, who edited Women Voters in Indian Elections - Changing Trends and Emerging Patterns, said. In 2019 general election, men and women voted in nearly equal numbers, he added.

104.title: World's smallest singer performs at AR Rahman's daughter's wedding reception
104.article_body: A video has shown music composer AR Rahman listening to the world's smallest singer Abdu Rozik performing 'Papa Kehte Hain' at the former's daughter's wedding reception. The video was shared by the Tajik singer on his Instagram page with the caption "Godfather". The reception for Rahman's daughter Khatija and son-in-law Riyasdeen Shaik Mohamed was held in Chennai on Friday.

105.title: Indian startup FarEye fires 250 workers globally ahead of appraisal: Report
105.article_body: Indian logistics startup FarEye has laid off as many as 250 employees globally ahead of their appraisal, as per reports. The startup's Co-Founder and CEO Kushal Nahata cited the "softness in market conditions" as the reason behind this move. In 2021, Nahata said FarEye aimed to become a unicorn in 6-12 months after raising $100 million in series E funding.

106.title: Contain Tamil Nadu's COVID-19 spread: CM MK Stalin tells officials
106.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Saturday said measures should be taken to contain the spread of coronavirus in the state and facilities to treat affected patients should be kept ready, in view of rising cases. Stalin, who chaired a meeting to review the COVID-19 situation, advised various departments and local administration to join hands in containing the COVID-19 spread.

107.title: 42-year-old man kills sister over property dispute in Ahmedabad
107.article_body: A 42-year-old man, Madan Singh, allegedly stabbed his younger sister to death over a property dispute in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Friday. Police said the incident occurred around 2 am when Madan Singh stabbed his sister and injured his father and nephew when they tried to prevent him. A murder case has been filed against Singh, who is currently absconding.

108.title: 2 terrorists killed in separate encounters in J&K's Kulgam, Pulwama
108.article_body: Two terrorists were killed in two separate encounters with security forces in J&K's Kulgam and Pulwama districts on Saturday, police said. Arms and ammunition, including a rifle along with 23 rounds and a hand grenade, were recovered from the encounter site in Kulgam, an official said. The terrorist killed in Kulgam belonged to Hizbul Mujahideen terror outfit, the official added.

109.title: With 4 games remaining, we've chance to win series vs SA: Bhuvneshwar
109.article_body: Ahead of India-South Africa second T20I, India pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar said with four matches remaining, his side has a chance to win the five-match series. "We've to bowl better and we need to bat in the same fashion as the previous game," he added. Match will be played in Cuttack on Sunday. India trail South Africa 0-1 in ongoing series.

110.title: Home Minister Shah seeks early probe of rape, sexual assault cases
110.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday sought an early investigation of rape and sexual assault cases against women and children, according to an official. Shah also sought stringent punishment against the offenders in a time-bound manner, the official said. Shah made the comments at the 25th meeting of the Western Zonal Council in Diu.

111.title: 3 killed, 1 injured after being hit by train in UP's Prayagraj
111.article_body: Three persons were killed and another person was injured after being hit by a train at Shankargarh railway station in Prayagraj, an official said. Some passengers got down on the other side of the platform and while returning, they were hit by the Chambal Express, the official said. It is yet to be known why they got off the train.

112.title: Bride's sister killed, 10 injured in firing at UP wedding function
112.article_body: The 35-year-old sister of a bride was killed and 10 persons were injured when gunshots were fired during a quarrel at a wedding function in Uttar Pradesh's Etah on Saturday. "An argument broke out between the family members of the bride and some villagers over applying colours," SP Etah said. He added that some suspects have been detained for questioning.

113.title: He might play at Wimbledon: Toni after nephew Nadal's foot treatment
113.article_body: Rafael Nadal's uncle Toni Nadal revealed that his nephew has been feeling "much better" after the foot treatment and wants to train. "And if he has a little chance, he'll play at Wimbledon. He goes on the court on Monday," he added. Days after his record-extending 14th French Open win, Nadal began treatment for his chronic foot problem in Barcelona.

114.title: Hate and unrest not our way, says Rahul Gandhi
114.article_body: A day after the outbreak of violence during protests over ex-BJP leaders' remarks on Prophet Muhammad, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday tweeted, "Hate and unrest isn't our way." "Our country has always set an example of truth, non-violence and brotherhood before the world," he said. "It's the responsibility of all...people...to unite India and maintain mutual goodwill," he added.

115.title: It could be society ending: Bill Gates on another virus with 5% fatality rate
115.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates said the emergence of another virus with similar virulence to COVID-19 but with 5% fatality rate could be "society ending". He said the world got "lucky" that the death rate per COVID-19 case was 0.2%. "Given the toll of this pandemic...20 million dead globally, a million in the US...it could've been way more fatal," Gates claimed.

116.title: Indian crypto investors got lucky due to tax announcement in Feb: Zerodha CEO
116.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath on Saturday said many Indian cryptocurrency investors "accidentally got lucky" due to announcement of TDS and tax on crypto during the Budget in February. If not for the announcement, "many could've potentially been trapped trying to buy the dip and then averaging down", Kamath said. The government had announced 30% tax on income from digital assets.

117.title: Nayanthara-Vignesh Shivan get notice for violating Tirupati temple rules, apologise
117.article_body: Nayanthara and Vignesh Shivan, who visited Tirupati temple after their wedding, received notices for wearing footwear inside the temple and doing photoshoots. "In the commotion, we failed to notice we were walking with shoes...We apologise," the couple said. "We've been to Tirupati five times in...last month with the desire to get married...Due to various reasons, it wasn't possible," they added.

118.title: India will definitely bounce back in 2nd T20I: SA all-rounder Parnell
118.article_body: South Africa all-rounder Wayne Parnell said the side's second T20I against India in Cuttack will be crucial, adding the hosts will definitely bounce back. "They're a quality side; we don't expect anything less...every single game till Bengaluru is going to be tough," he added. South Africa are currently leading 1-0 in five-match series. Second T20I will be played on Sunday.

119.title: Development works not done to win elections, says PM Modi in Gujarat
119.article_body: During his visit to Gujarat on Friday, PM Narendra Modi said that his government's development projects are not undertaken to win elections but for the good of the people. It is the "people who make us win elections", he added. Notably, PM Modi laid foundation stones, inaugurated and dedicated projects worth ₹3,050 crore during his day-long visit to the state.

120.title: Team India trains in packed stadium in Cuttack, BCCI shares pics
120.article_body: The BCCI took to Twitter to share pictures from Team India's training at the Barabati Stadium in Cuttack ahead of the second T20I against South Africa. "Match day feels on a non-match day...A packed stadium here in Cuttack to watch Team India train," BCCI wrote. "This is why there should be more matches in small towns," a fan commented.

121.title: New Zealand record their highest 5th wicket partnership in Test cricket history
121.article_body: New Zealand recorded their highest partnership for fifth wicket in Test cricket history during their first innings against England in the second Test. Daryl Mitchell and Tom Blundell shared a 236-run stand to set the record. The previous record was held by Nathan Astle and Craig McMillan, who shared a 222-run stand against Zimbabwe in Wellington in 2000.

122.title: Mamata calls Opposition leaders' meeting ahead of Presidential poll
122.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has called for a meeting of Opposition leaders on June 15 in New Delhi ahead of the election for the next President of India on July 18. "At a time when our democracy is going through troubling times, I believe that a fruitful confluence of opposition voices is the need of the hour," she said.

123.title: I like both: Shaheen Afridi on choosing between Kohli and Babar
123.article_body: On being asked to pick either Virat Kohli or Babar Azam, Pakistan pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi replied, "I like both, yeah!" Recently, Babar became the fastest batter to score 1,000 runs as skipper in the ODI format. He achieved this mark in 13 innings as Pakistan captain, breaking India captain Kohli's record, which he set in 17 innings.

124.title: China warns of new 'strongly explosive' COVID-19 outbreak in Beijing
124.article_body: Authorities in China's capital Beijing have warned of a new outbreak of COVID-19 cases related to a bar, saying that the outbreak is "strongly explosive in nature". The outbreak is "widespread in scope and composition of individuals involved is also complex", said a spokesman of the Beijing municipal government. Beijing has reported 115 cases linked to the bar outbreak.

125.title: We just got lucky the death rate per COVID-19 case was 0.2%: Bill Gates
125.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates said the world got "lucky" that the death rate per COVID-19 case was 0.2%. "Given the toll of this pandemic...20 million dead globally, a million in the US...it could have been way more fatal," the billionaire claimed. He further said the emergence of another virus with similar virulence but 5% fatality rate could be "society ending".

126.title: Buildings of violence-accused bulldozed in UP after protests over Prophet remarks
126.article_body: Buildings of those accused of violence during recent protests over remarks on Prophet Muhammad were demolished in UP's Kanpur and Saharanpur on Saturday. In Kanpur, parts of a building owned by businessman Mohammad Ishtiyaq, a relative of 'key conspirator' Hayat Zafar Hashmi, were demolished. In Saharanpur, the houses of two of the accused, Muzammil and Abdul Waqir, were razed.

127.title: Candidates who submitted blank sheets hired as teachers in Bengal: CBI
127.article_body: A probe into irregularities during recruitment of primary school teachers in West Bengal has found that some candidates who submitted blank answer sheets have been hired to teach, a CBI official said on Saturday. The candidates had only written their names and registration numbers on the sheets, the official added. Several officials are involved in the irregularities, the official claimed.

128.title: Cong expels Haryana MLA Kuldeep Bishnoi for cross-voting in Rajya Sabha polls
128.article_body: The Congress on Saturday expelled Haryana MLA Kuldeep Bishnoi from all party positions, including the post of the special invitee to the Congress Working Committee, for cross-voting in the Rajya Sabha elections. Congress said while Bishnoi cross-voted, the vote of another MLA was declared invalid. CM Manohar Lal Khattar has claimed that Bishnoi voted after "listening to his inner conscience".

129.title: Celebrity fashion designer Prathyusha Garimella found dead at her home in Telangana
129.article_body: Celebrity fashion designer Prathyusha Garimella was found dead at her residence in Telangana, police said on Saturday. Police have seized a carbon monoxide cylinder from her bedroom and a case has been registered under the section of suspicious death, said ANI while quoting a circle inspector. Her body has been shifted to the Osmania Hospital for autopsy.

130.title: Hockey India congratulates Rani on completing 250 international caps
130.article_body: Hockey India has congratulated striker Rani Rampal on completing 250 international caps on Saturday. Rani, who has been on a long injury layoff after Tokyo Olympics, achieved this milestone during India's match against Belgium in FIH Women's Pro Hockey League in Antwerp, Belgium. "This is a very special moment for me...it is indeed a milestone to remember," said Rani.

131.title: ₹11.97-crore tax evasion detected at hotels near Gir National Park
131.article_body: The Gujarat Goods and Services Tax department conducted searches on hotels, resorts and booking agents operating in and around Sasan Gir National Park and found tax evasion worth ₹11.97 crore. According to an official statement, the hotels and resorts were found to have recorded lower room tariffs, provided unaccounted services and also paid tax under low slabs.

132.title: I'd love to be in BCCI administration if that comes my way: Mithali
132.article_body: Former India Women Test and ODI captain Mithali Raj said she'd love to be in BCCI administration if it comes her way, given the experience she has had in her 23-year-long career. "You can have a woman in a certain position because women understand women's cricket much better," she added. The 39-year-old represented India in 333 matches across all formats.

133.title: Mumbai reports 1,745 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death; active cases cross 10,000
133.article_body: Mumbai has reported 1,745 fresh COVID-19 cases, 888 recoveries and one death in the last 24 hours. The active cases in the city have crossed the 10,000-mark to stand at 10,047, reportedly after a gap of several months. Mumbai has reported a positivity rate of 12.26% and the overall growth rate of cases between June 4 and 10 was 0.122%.

134.title: China hardening its position along border with India: US Defence Secretary
134.article_body: China has continued to "harden its position along the border that it shares with India", US Defence Secretary Lloyd J Austin said on Saturday. America stands by its friends as they uphold their rights, Austin said, adding that Beijing is adopting a "war coercive", "aggressive approach" to its territorial claims. An American general recently called Chinese activities near Ladakh "alarming".

135.title: Apple's M1 chip has a hardware flaw that can't be patched, claim MIT researchers
135.article_body: Researchers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) have claimed that they have discovered a new hardware vulnerability in Apple's M1 chip, which cannot be fixed by any software patch. The researchers said that they created a novel hardware attack, which is capable of exploiting the M1 chip's last line of security defence, pointer authentication code, without leaving a trace.

136.title: Kashmiri YouTuber arrested for posting video depicting beheading of Nupur Sharma
136.article_body: Kashmiri YouTuber Faisal Wani was on Saturday arrested and booked after his video depicting the beheading of ex-BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma surfaced online, J&K Police said. "He had uploaded an incriminating video on YouTube which is against public tranquillity and has caused fear and alarm to the public in general," said police. Wani had earlier apologised and deleted the video.

137.title: Kuldeep was one of my targets in IPL mega auction: DC head coach Ponting
137.article_body: DC head coach Ricky Ponting has revealed spinner Kuldeep Yadav was one of his main targets heading into 2022 IPL mega auction. "Because I've seen how good he has been in the past. His skill hadn't gone anywhere," he added. Kuldeep, who was bought for ₹2 crore, was DC's highest wicket-taker in IPL 2022 with 21 wickets in 14 matches.

138.title: Internet services suspended in West Bengal's Beldanga, Murshidabad
138.article_body: The West Bengal government has temporarily suspended internet services in Beldanga and Murshidabad till 6 am on June 14 in a bid to stop rumours and prevent unlawful activities owing to protests over remarks against Prophet Muhammad. This comes a day after internet services were suspended in violence-hit Howrah till June 13 and Section 144 was imposed in several areas.

139.title: Gang helping migrants get Aadhaar illegally busted in Bengaluru
139.article_body: The Bengaluru Rural Police said that they've busted a nine-member gang for allegedly helping foreign migrants, especially from Bangladesh, get Aadhaar card and other citizenship-related documents illegally. The accused used to charge the migrants between ₹500 and ₹1,000 for the service. The police also said that they've seized 31 Aadhaar cards, 13 PAN cards and 28 voter ID cards.

140.title: Paytm begins charging some users extra fees for mobile recharges: Report
140.article_body: Paytm has reportedly begun charging some of its users a small fee for mobile recharges done via the financial platform. This charge can be anywhere between ₹1 and ₹6, depending on how large the recharge amount is. The fee is being levied on mobile recharges paid for via UPI or a bank credit/debit card.

141.title: 19-yr-old TikTok star Cooper Noriega found dead hours after post about dying young
141.article_body: Cooper Noriega, a 19-year-old TikTok star with over 1.7 million followers, died on Thursday. According to officials, Noriega was found dead in a Los Angeles mall parking lot. He had tweeted a video of himself lying in bed with the message, "Who else [be] thinking they [gonna] die young af?" just hours before his death, reported Variety.

142.title: 35 stalls sealed during anti-encroachment drive in Pune
142.article_body: At least 35 stalls were sealed during an anti-encroachment drive carried out by the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) on Friday. "This drive has come about because of complaints and demands from people for new licenses," said PMC's Anti-encroachment Department Head. He added that about 60% of the license holders had rented out their stalls, making running these stalls illegal.

143.title: 20-year-old man stabs 18-yr-old to death in Mumbai, arrested
143.article_body: Police said that they have arrested a 20-year-old man for allegedly stabbing an 18-year-old girl to death at her residence in Mumbai's Govandi area. Police said that the incident took place when the victim, Fauziya Khan, was alone at home. "We have detained the accused and are questioning him to find out the reason for the attack," police added.

144.title: GHMC Mayor inspects Strategic Nala Development Programme in Hyd
144.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal conducted a surprise inspection of the Strategic Nala Development Programme (SNDP) works on Friday. She directed the officials to speed up the work while taking the required precautionary measures. "Sixty works have been undertaken at a cost of ₹985 crore," Gadwal had said earlier.

145.title: Copper wire worth ₹10 lakh stolen from Police Command Centre in Hyd
145.article_body: Copper bundles worth ₹10 lakh were stolen from an under-construction Police Command Centre in Hyderabad's Banjara Hills. Police said that it was an 'inside job' and that a construction worker was stealing copper wire bundles to resell them at a higher value. The Command and Control Centre is being constructed at Banjara Hills at an estimated cost of ₹600 crore.

146.title: 45-year-old man electrocuted while pruning trees in Navi Mumbai
146.article_body: A 45-year-old worker, Gautam Yadav, died after being hit by a high voltage power line while pruning trees in Navi Mumbai's Vashi. "The society had sought permission from us to get branches trimmed before the monsoon begins," said Vashi ward officer. The permission letter mentioned it is their responsibility to look after property and life during the process, he added.

147.title: Pune civic body gets 30 fogging machines for cleaning activities
147.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has received 30 fogging machines for cleaning activities in the 23 newly merged areas. PMC Additional Municipal Commissioner Ravindra Binwade said that the machines have been procured with the help of CSR fund. A PMC official added that the authorities aim to carry out timely spraying and fogging during monsoon to prevent waterborne diseases.

148.title: 227 arrested in UP so far over protests against remarks on Prophet
148.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police has arrested 227 people so far in connection with violence during protests that broke out across the state against remarks on Prophet Muhammad by former BJP leaders. "Strictest action will be taken against anti-social elements involved in the chaotic efforts to spoil the atmosphere in various cities in the past few days," CM Yogi Adityanath told officials.

149.title: Mithali calls me 'Prime Minister' because I talk a lot: Yastika
149.article_body: Speaking about ex-teammate Mithali Raj, who recently announced her retirement from all forms of international cricket, India Women batter Yastika Bhatia stated, "Mithali Di calls me 'Prime Minister' because I talk a lot in team meetings and give my opinions." She added, "We've a great bond. In my debut, Mithali Di was the captain and she guided me very well."

150.title: GB Nagar policeman dismissed for skipping work for nearly 200 days
150.article_body: A constable of Gautam Buddha Nagar Police has been dismissed for violating Uttar Pradesh government service rules after he remained absent from work without permission for nearly 200 days, officials said. Chitrasen Kumar got married for the second time without separating from his first wife during the same period, they added. Kumar has been booked for the second marriage.

151.title: BJP MP loses 15 kg after Gadkari promises ₹1,000cr in development funds for each kg lost
151.article_body: Ujjain BJP MP Anil Firojiya claimed he lost 15 kg since February 2022, when Union Minister Nitin Gadkari had promised to clear ₹1,000 crore for the development of Ujjain for every kg that Firojiya lost. "I am the most expensive MP in the world," said the 50-year-old MP, who weighed 127 kg when Gadkari made the promise at an event.

152.title: 1 dead, 6 injured after part of building collapses in Navi Mumbai
152.article_body: One person died and at least six others sustained injuries after part of a building collapsed in Navi Mumbai's Nerul on Saturday. As per reports, the ceiling slab of a sixth-floor flat collapsed while some drilling work of the flooring was underway. Several other residents are reportedly feared trapped under debris. An operation to rescue the trapped persons is underway.

153.title: It's something special: Swiatek on breaking Serena's 34 wins in a row record
153.article_body: Talking about breaking Serena Williams' unbeaten run of 34 matches, set in 2013, world number one Iga Swiatek said "it's something special". She added, "I always wanted to have some kind of a record. In tennis, it's pretty hard after Serena's career." The 21-year-old Pole claimed her second French Open title by winning her 35th consecutive match on Sunday.

154.title: Threatened by CM's envoy: Prime accused in Kerala gold smuggling
154.article_body: Swapna Suresh, prime accused in Kerala gold smuggling case, has released an audio clip, where a man was allegedly heard threatening her to withdraw her statement claiming CM Pinarayi Vijayan and his family's involvement in the case. Suresh claimed the man, Shaj Kiran, is an envoy of CM to limit further damage. Kiran said that the audio seems "heavily edited".

155.title: I was a college dropout, had to prove myself: Unicorn startup PhysicsWallah's CEO
155.article_body: Alakh Pandey, the Founder and CEO of edtech startup PhysicsWallah which achieved unicorn status this week, told YourStory, "I was a college dropout and I had to prove myself." Pandey started PhysicsWallah as a YouTube channel in 2016 with an investment of about ₹30,000. The startup has raised $100 million in its Series A funding at a $1.1 billion valuation.

156.title: Bengal BJP chief put under house arrest for trying to visit riot-hit Howrah
156.article_body: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar on Saturday claimed he was placed under house arrest by police, on CM Mamata Banerjee's instruction. "Bengal needs strong action against people...disturbing peace in the state and not house arrest of BJP leaders," he tweeted. The incident reportedly took place when Majumdar was trying to visit violence-hit Howrah, where Section 144 is currently imposed.

157.title: Very happy that all our 3 candidates won: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis
157.article_body: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Saturday expressed happiness after BJP won three out of six Rajya Sabha seats in Maharashtra. "Very happy that all our three candidates- Piyush Goyal, Anil Bonde, and Dhananjay Mahadik have been elected to Rajya Sabha," he said. "Mahadik ne aisa dhobi pachhad lagaya...that he got more votes than Sanjay Raut," he added.

158.title: Pant is an outstanding young man, got the world at his feet: Ponting
158.article_body: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting said Rishabh Pant is an "outstanding" young man who has got the world "at his feet". "He'll be exceptionally dangerous for India, especially on the wickets we’ll prepare in Australia (for the T20 World Cup) – good, fast, flat, bouncy wickets," added Ponting. Ponting is the head coach of IPL franchise DC. Pant is DC's captain.

159.title: Yuvraj has been married to golf since retirement, jokes his mom Shabnam
159.article_body: Yuvraj Singh's mother Shabnam Singh jokingly said he has been married to golf since retirement, adding it's been two months since she saw Yuvraj. Yuvraj announced his retirement from international cricket on June 10, 2019. "I love the sport but...also hate it...I hate it because it has been very tough on me mentally," he had said in his retirement video.

160.title: Ghaziabad civic body plans to start door-to-door e-waste collection
160.article_body: The Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation (GMC) has announced that it plans to start door-to-door e-waste collection from households from next month. The move is expected to generate an estimated 500 tonnes of e-waste every month, according to a report. Currently, households in the city depend primarily on scrap dealers to sell their e-waste, the report said.

161.title: Murray beats top seed Tsitsipas to reach Boss Open semis in Stuttgart
161.article_body: Unseeded Andy Murray defeated top seed Stefanos Tsitsipas 7-6(7-4), 6-3 to advance to the Boss Open semi-final in Stuttgart on Friday. It was the former world number one's first victory over a top-five player since 2016. Murray is now 1-1 in head-to-head against Tsitsipas and has improved to 113-23 on grass. He'll now face Australia's Nick Kyrgios.

162.title: Wanted to do something Spielberg, James Cameron did in Hollywood: Ayan Mukerji
162.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji, while talking about his upcoming film 'Brahmāstra', said he wanted to be that young director who is trying to do something that Steven Spielberg or James Cameron did in Hollywood. He said that he wanted to create the same impact with an Indian story. "I didn't want to do it with stories that were western," Mukerji added.

163.title: Doctors said I had 2 weeks to live: Director Anurag Basu on battling blood cancer
163.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Basu, speaking about his battle with blood cancer in 2004, revealed that doctors said he had two weeks left to live. "My condition started deteriorating rapidly...My platelets were decreasing," he said in an episode of Unfiltered By Samdish. "The day I got scared was when my mom and dad stopped facing me in the hospital," Anurag stated.

164.title: Rainfall predicted in several states over next 5 days, IMD releases list
164.article_body: IMD predicted rainfall in Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura, sub-Himalayan Sikkim and parts of West Bengal during the next five days. Bihar, Jharkhand, Odisha, MP, Vidarbha (Maharashtra) and Chhattisgarh will also likely see isolated/scattered rain. IMD also forecast rain in Karnataka, Kerala, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Tamil Nadu, Lakshadweep and Puducherry.

165.title: Sara Ali Khan to star opposite Ayushmann in 'Dream Girl 2': Report
165.article_body: Sara Ali Khan will reportedly star opposite Ayushmann Khurrana in the sequel of 'Dream Girl'. "They (makers) think Sara fits the bill, and have begun talks with her," Mid-day quoted a source as saying. The film will go on floors later in the year, reports added. Notably, the first part released in 2019 with Nushrratt Bharuccha as the female lead.

166.title: Playing first-division matches a part of workload management: Ashwin
166.article_body: Having played first-division matches recently, India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin said he considers playing such matches as a part of workload management, adding playing such games enabled him to shift from T20 cricket to red-ball cricket. "As you grow older, you...play smarter," added Ashwin. "I can contribute with the bat and bowl well. I want to...keep working," stated Ashwin.

167.title: Australia-France reach $583 mn settlement over scrapped submarine deal
167.article_body: The Australian government has reached a €555 million ($583.58 million) settlement with France over a scrapped submarine deal. Australia last year had scrapped a $40 billion submarine contract with French military shipyard Naval Group in favour of a deal with the US and UK to build nuclear-powered submarines. The move had created a rift between the two countries.

168.title: Kids made me get a heart check-up after KK's death: Shaan
168.article_body: Singer Shaan has revealed that he received many messages from people asking him to take care of his health after KK died on May 31, shortly after performing at a concert in Kolkata. "My children were also insisting, so I especially went to Mumbai...and had heart check-up," he added. Shaan also urged people to take out time for routine check-ups.

169.title: Felt like I was watching real Sandy: Major Sandeep's colleague on 'Major'
169.article_body: Razzaque Adil, colleague of Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan, has penned a note praising Adivi Sesh's latest film 'Major', which is based on the life of Unnikrishnan. "Adivi looks the part and gets Sandy's mannerisms right...In some scenes, I felt like I was watching...real Sandy on screen," he wrote, adding that 'Major' is a "well-made movie which gets most of the facts...right".

170.title: Twitter Co-founder Dorsey's TBD to build Bitcoin-based 'Web5'
170.article_body: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey-owned Block's subsidiary TBD will be building a new Bitcoin-focussed decentralised web platform called 'Web5'. "Web5 brings decentralised identity and data storage to individual's applications," TBD explained. TBD lead Mike Brock said that Web5 would beat out incumbent models by abandoning their blockchain-centric approaches to an identity-focussed web experience.

171.title: 72-yr-old arrested for extorting over ₹3 lakh from builder in Thane
171.article_body: Police arrested a 72-year-old man for allegedly extorting over ₹3 lakh from a builder in Maharashtra's Thane. The accused, who claimed to be an activist, allegedly made applications stating that redevelopment work at a housing society under the builder was illegal and demanded ₹5 lakh from him to withdraw the applications. Police caught him accepting ₹3.11 lakh on Thursday.

172.title: Google employee calculates value of pi to 100 tn digits in a new world record
172.article_body: Google Cloud employee Emma Haruka Iwao has calculated the value of pi to its 100-trillionth digit, which is zero, in a new world record. Three years ago, Iwao had calculated 31.4 trillion digits of pi, setting a world record at the time. This record was broken by Swiss scientists last year, when they calculated another 31.4 trillion digits of pi.

173.title: 6 Indian banks sue GVK Coal Developers for over ₹11,700cr for loan default: Report
173.article_body: Six Indian banks, namely Canara Bank, ICICI Bank, Bank of Baroda, Bank of India, Axis Bank and Indian Overseas Bank, have reportedly sued GVK Coal Developers (Singapore), for over ₹11,700 crore ($1.5 billion), in London High Court. The dispute is over a $1-billion loan default, a $35-million letter of credit facility lent in 2011 and a $160-million loan from 2014.
