He added, "They should better understand that they will never be allowed to come back to Allen ever." Maheshwari's remarks come after edtech unicorn Unacademy opens its offline centre in Kota.

348.title: I'd have Karthik in at that 5 or 6 slot in India's T20 WC squad: Ponting
348.article_body: Ricky Ponting said he would pick wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik in India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022. "I'd have him in at that five or six roles. The way...he finished games for RCB this year, he took his game to another level," he added. Karthik scored 330 runs in 16 matches at a strike rate of 183.33 in IPL 2022.

349.title: Jama Masjid protest held without permit, will take legal action: Delhi Police
349.article_body: After a protest erupted at Delhi's Jama Masjid on Friday against alleged inflammatory remarks on Prophet Muhammad, police said they have identified some "miscreants" behind the agitation. "Protests were done on the street without any permission, so legal action will be taken," DCP (Central) Shweta Chauhan said. Chauhan added that police brought the situation under control within 10-15 minutes.

350.title: What is Amyloidosis, the condition that Pak's ex-Prez Pervez Musharraf is suffering from?
350.article_body: Former Pakistan President Pervez Musharraf is suffering from Amyloidosis, his family said. It's a rare disease that occurs when amyloid proteins are deposited in tissues and organs. Amyloid proteins are abnormal proteins the body cannot break down and recycle. Buildup of amyloid deposits damages organs and tissues and it most frequently affects kidneys, heart, nervous system and liver.

351.title: Will not hesitate to start war over Taiwan, China tells US
351.article_body: Beijing will "not hesitate to start a war" if Taiwan declares independence, China's Defence Minister warned his US counterpart Lloyd Austin. This came as Wei Fenghe held his first face-to-face meeting with Austin on sidelines of Shangri-La Dialogue security summit in Singapore. Fenghe vowed Beijing would "smash to smithereens any 'Taiwan independence' plot", said Chinese Defence Ministry.

352.title: MP man carries 4-yr-old daughter's body after being denied hearse
352.article_body: A man in Madhya Pradesh's Chhattarpur district was purportedly seen carrying the body of his four-year-old daughter, as he was unable to find an ambulance. The girl's grandfather claimed that the family had also asked for a hearse at the Damoh district hospital, but was not provided one by authorities. A civil surgeon at the hospital has denied the claim.

353.title: Tourist causes ₹20 lakh in damage to Roman heritage site by throwing e-scooter
353.article_body: An American tourist caused damages worth £21,000 (around ₹20 lakh) after she deliberately threw an e-scooter down the famous 18th-century Spanish steps in Rome. The 28-year-old and her 29-year-old male companion were fined £343 (around ₹33,000) each over the incident. The 16th and 29th steps of the UNESCO World Heritage site were damaged and other sections were also chipped.

354.title: Body of man who fell from Sikkim bridge while clicking pics found
354.article_body: The Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) has recovered the body of a local driver, who fell into the riverbed from Sikkim's Rit Chu Bridge while clicking pictures. The driver, along with a tourist, was clicking pictures while standing at the edge of the bridge when they both lost balance and fell. Search for the missing tourist from Bihar is underway.

355.title: PM Modi unveils development projects worth ₹3,050 crore in Gujarat
355.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday inaugurated and laid the foundation stone of multiple development projects worth ₹3,050 crore during 'Gujarat Gaurav Abhiyan' programme in Gujarat's Navsari. These projects are aimed at improving the water supply in the region, along with boosting connectivity and enhancing the ease of living. "We treat being in government as an opportunity to serve," he said.

356.title: I was told to get breast implants, botox; it made me angrier: Radhika Apte
356.article_body: Radhika Apte revealed that when she was new in the film industry, she was told "to do lots of jobs" on her body and face. "First meeting I had, I was told to change my nose. Second meeting...I was told to get a boob job...Then I was told to do...botox," she stated. "I never felt pressurised...I felt angrier," said Radhika.

357.title: 4 persons arrested for beating suspected thief to death in Mumbai
357.article_body: Police said that four persons have been arrested for allegedly beating a suspected thief to death in Mumbai's Mulund area. The 28-year-old deceased had entered a house intending to steal valuables, police said. One of the four occupants of the house noticed and caught him, after which all four of them assaulted the victim with wooden sticks, police added.

358.title: India to provide 5,000 tonnes of rice in aid to Madagascar
358.article_body: India has announced that it will provide 5,000 tonnes of rice in aid to Madagascar amid a humanitarian crisis in the country. The announcement comes after a meeting between the Ambassador of India to Madagascar and Comoros, Abhay Kumar, and Madagascar's PM Christian Ntsay. The shipment of rice from India to the island nation is likely to reach in July.

359.title: 30-yr-old Navi Mumbai man arrested, drugs worth ₹60,000 seized
359.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested by the Anti-Narcotics Cell of the Crime Branch in Navi Mumbai's Taloja for selling charas behind a school. Police said they seized 75 grams of charas worth ₹60,000 from the accused. The accused Jai Santosh Gufta was selling drugs to the youth and where he got the drugs from is being investigated, the police added.

360.title: 4 persons arrested for auto driver's murder in Hyderabad
360.article_body: The Hyderabad Police have arrested four persons involved in the murder of an auto driver, who had stopped them from extorting money from a transgender. Charminar ACP G Bhiksham Reddy said the accused attacked the auto driver and his friend on June 5 with knives and liquor bottles. The auto driver succumbed to injuries on the way to the hospital.

361.title: Policeman opens fire in Kolkata, shoots woman before killing self
361.article_body: A policeman allegedly fired several shots using his service rifle outside the Bangladesh Deputy High Commission in Kolkata's Park Circus area on Friday. A woman, who was riding pillion on a two-wheeler, fell down after being hit by a bullet, and died on the spot, police said. The accused policeman later shot himself dead. Preliminary investigations are underway, police added.

362.title: Woman dies on wedding anniversary as bus hits motorbike in Hyd
362.article_body: A 26-year-old woman was killed while her husband escaped with injuries on their wedding anniversary after a bus rammed into their motorbike in Hyderabad on Thursday. "The couple along with their son Bunny went to a temple near Chandanagar and the accident occurred...while they were returning home," police said. The woman's husband and their son were rushed to a hospital.

363.title: Mob in J&K's Bhaderwah defies curfew, pelts stones; CRPF trooper hurt
363.article_body: A mob of around 150 people on Friday morning came out on the streets and pelted stones at security personnel in Bhaderwah town of Jammu and Kashmir's Doda district. A Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel has sustained injuries in the incident. According to a police officer, security forces had to fire tear gas shells to disperse the mob.

364.title: India's Lakshya Sen loses in quarters at Indonesia Masters 2022
364.article_body: India's Lakshya Sen lost to Chou Tien Chen in the quarter-finals of Indonesia Masters Super 500 tournament on Friday. Third-seeded Tien Chen beat the World Championships bronze medallist 21-16, 12-21, 21-14 in one hour two minutes. This was Lakshya's second straight defeat against Tien Chen in less than a month, having lost during the group stage of the Thomas Cup.

365.title: He takes his job seriously: Paytm CEO on 'number of days' timer in MoS IT's office
365.article_body: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma took to Twitter to share a picture with Minister of State for Electronics & Technology Rajeev Chandrasekhar after meeting with him on Friday. "Rarely you will meet someone who takes his job so seriously, and puts a number of days timer," Sharma said, referring to a clock in Chandrasekhar's office.

366.title: Organs malfunctioning, recovery not possible: Pervez Musharraf's family on his health
366.article_body: Former Pakistan President Pervez Musharraf's family, while issuing a statement on his health, said, "He is not on the ventilator. Has been hospitalised for the last 3 weeks due to a complication of his ailment (Amyloidosis)." "Going through a difficult stage where recovery is not possible and organs are malfunctioning. Pray for ease in his daily living," the statement read.

367.title: New Zealand to tax burps of cows & sheep to cut greenhouse gas emissions
367.article_body: New Zealand has released a draft plan to tax sheep and cattle burps in a bid to cut greenhouse gas emissions, making it the first country to do so. Farmers will be charged for the burps of their livestock from 2025. Methane from belching sheep and cattle is among the biggest contributors to greenhouse gas emissions in New Zealand.

368.title: Historians gave prominence to Mughals, ignored Pandyas & Mauryas: Shah
368.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah on Friday said that most of the historians in India have given prominence in recording the history of Mughals, while ignoring the reigns of many empires like Pandyas, Mauryas, Guptas and Ahoms. Reference books should be written on these empires, he added. "Our glorious history should be kept in front of the public," he further said.

369.title: Ranchi policemen hurt amid protest against Prophet remarks; curfew imposed
369.article_body: Some police personnel sustained injuries in Jharkhand's Ranchi on Friday while trying to control an angry mob near a Hanuman temple on the Main Road. Protests broke out in the city over former BJP leaders' remarks on Prophet Muhammad. Vehicles were torched and vandalised by protesters and stone-pelting was also reported in Ranchi, where a curfew has now been imposed.

370.title: Lost treasure, gold coins worth billions discovered in centuries-old shipwreck
370.article_body: Colombian Navy has released footage of the San José, a Spanish galleon that sank over 300 years ago. The footage also revealed existence of two other historical wrecks in the water nearby. Images show gold ingots and coins and Spanish cannons dating back to 1655. It's believed the cargo could be worth as much as $17 billion in today's money.

371.title: Avesh can become an excellent bowler in all 3 formats: Gambhir
371.article_body: LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir said India and LSG pacer Avesh Khan has a lot of talent and only the IPL shouldn't be his goal. "If he continues to work hard, he can become an excellent bowler, not only in T20Is but in all three formats," he added. Avesh posted 0/35 in India's seven-wicket loss to South Africa in first T20I.

372.title: Plan was to target loose balls, put pressure on bowlers in 1st T20I: Kishan
372.article_body: Talking about his strategy in India-South Africa first T20I, India opener Ishan Kishan (76) said he wanted to target the loose balls and put pressure on the bowlers. "My plan was to just keep them (Kagiso Rabada and Anrich Nortje) on...backfoot, keep playing my shots so that they're also thinking and...move their line...length," he added. India lost by seven wickets.

373.title: Plastic eating 'superworms' could revolutionise recycling: Study
373.article_body: Researchers have found that Zophobas morio, the larvae of darkling beetle, known as 'superworms' can survive on a diet of polystyrene. They are believed to digest the plastic through gut enzymes. According to researcher Dr Chris Rinke, these 'superworms' are like mini recycling plants that shred polystyrene with their mouth and feed it to the bacteria in their gut.

374.title: Wanted to become music director, not singer: Mika on 'Saawan Mein...'
374.article_body: Mika Singh, while talking about his 1998 song 'Saawan Mein Lag Gayi Aag', said back then he was not serious about becoming a professional singer. "At the time, I wanted to be a music director, and not...singer," Mika said, calling it the reason for not paying attention to his singing. "It didn't matter to me that...song had...nasal tone," Mika added.

375.title: Zinedine Zidane to become PSG coach from next season: Report
375.article_body: Former French captain Zinedine Zidane is likely to become the coach of the Paris St Germain club from next season. According to a French radio station Europe 1 report, the 49-year-old former footballer will replace 50-year-old Argentinian Mauricio Pochettino from next season. Notably, Zidane and PSG were "close to finding an agreement", the report said.

376.title: IIT-Kanpur tool to help UP police detect crypto transaction fraud
376.article_body: IIT Kanpur will be providing a tool, that can analyse cryptocurrency transactions, to the Uttar Pradesh police to detect cases of fraud. The tool, called HOP, is cheaper than any foreign equipment and will be ready for use by September, Professor Sandeep Shukla said. Subhash Chandra, ADG, Cybercrime, stressed on capacity-building for police departments to prepare to counter cybercrimes.

377.title: BJP govt should stop their PR against women's empowerment: TRS leader
377.article_body: TRS leader K Kavitha has questioned BJP over its campaign on women empowerment. "BJP government should for once out of sheer respect for women stop their PR against women's empowerment, when they continue to hide the truth behind extravagant publicity," Kavitha said. She added that BJP should apologise to Anganwadi workers "for slashing their budget by 50%".

378.title: Miracle for any normal person, he's different: Nadal's doctor on him
378.article_body: Rafael Nadal's doctor Ángel Ruiz-Cotorro said competing despite chronic foot pain as being experienced by Nadal would be a "miracle" for any normal person, adding that Nadal can do it as he really is "different". Ruiz-Cotorro stated radiofrequency ablation is being used to help Nadal recover. "We have more options...but they are more aggressive," he said.

379.title: Heatwave warnings issued for several states, IMD releases list
379.article_body: Heatwave condition in isolated places is very likely over Jharkhand during June 10-12 and over Punjab, Haryana-Delhi, Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan on June 10 and 11. IMD also predicted heatwave in Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Odisha on June 10. There's likely to be no significant change in maximum temperatures over northwest and central India during next 48 hours.

380.title: Take the extra mile: Wizz Air CEO asks staff to work through fatigue
380.article_body: European airline Wizz Air's CEO József Váradi is facing criticism after he told his staff that too many crew members were refusing to fly when fatigued. He said, "We're all fatigued but sometimes it is required to take the extra mile...We cannot run this business when every fifth person of a base reports sickness because the person is fatigued."

381.title: Ranbir is 'extremely loving, calls me ma'am': 'Animal' co-star Rashmika
381.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna, in a recent interview, shared her experience of working with 'Animal' co-star Ranbir Kapoor. "He's extremely loving," Rashmika stated, while calling Ranbir an "easygoing" person. "And he's the only one in the whole industry who calls me "ma'am," and I do not like it," Rashmika added. Directed by Sandeep Reddy Vanga, 'Animal' went on floors in Manali.

382.title: Man throws acid on woman for turning down marriage proposal in B'luru
382.article_body: A 36-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly throwing acid on a woman for turning down his marriage proposal in Bengaluru on Friday, police said. The 32-year-old woman, a divorcee with three children, sustained injuries in her right eye and is undergoing treatment in a private hospital, they added. The victim had known the accused for the past three years.

383.title: No signs of Russian military threat to Sweden & Finland: NATO
383.article_body: NATO's Deputy Secretary-General Mircea Geoana said that at present he sees no immediate military threat from Russia to aspiring NATO members, Sweden and Finland. Geoana also said he's confident that Sweden and Finland will join the military alliance despite Turkey's objection. Turkey has opposed Sweden and Finland's NATO bids accusing them of harbouring Kurdish militants and other terror groups.

384.title: Shutdown in J&K's Srinagar over ex-BJP leaders' remarks on Prophet
384.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar observed a shutdown on Friday in protest against former BJP leaders Nupur Sharma and Naveen Kumar Jindal's remarks on Prophet Muhammad. Shops and other business establishments remained closed at the Lal Chowk, among other parts of the city. As per reports, authorities suspended mobile internet services in Jammu, while broadband services remained operational.

385.title: Abu Dhabi's ADIA to buy 20% stake in IIFL Home Finance for ₹2,200 cr
385.article_body: Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) will invest ₹2,200 crore for a 20% stake in IIFL Home Finance. As of March 31, 2022, IIFL Finance's home loan arm has Assets Under Management of ₹23,617 crore. The deal will reportedly value the lender at ₹11,000 crore. It will mark one of the biggest investments in the affordable housing segment in India.

386.title: Israelis will be allowed to attend FIFA WC in Qatar: Officials
386.article_body: Despite not having formal diplomatic relations with Qatar, Israeli ministers have said that the country's residents will be allowed to visit Qatar for this year's FIFA World Cup. "Love of football and sport connects people and states, and the World Cup in November opens a new door for us to warm ties," Israel's Foreign Minister Yair Lapid said.

387.title: Sham trial: US after 3 foreigners who fought for Ukraine sentenced to death
387.article_body: US State Secretary Antony Blinken raised concern about a "sham trial" after two British fighters and a Moroccan captured while fighting for Ukraine were sentenced to death by a court in the Russian-occupied Donetsk region of Ukraine. "We call on Russia and its proxies to respect international humanitarian law, including the rights and protections afforded prisoners of war," Blinken added.

388.title: Policeman opens fire, kills woman then shoots self dead in WB
388.article_body: An on-duty police officer allegedly shot himself dead after he opened fire outside Bangladesh Deputy High Commission in West Bengal's Kolkata on Friday, police said. A woman, who was riding pillion on a two-wheeler, was hit by a bullet during the firing and died on the spot, police added. "The whole episode lasted for around five minutes," an eyewitness said.

389.title: Govt failed miserably in creating jobs for youth: KTR writes to PM Modi
389.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao has written an open letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi over the unemployment issue in the country and claimed that the BJP-led central government has failed miserably in creating jobs for the youth. "There are only 'pakoda' employment opportunities in the country today, all thanks to the inefficient policies of the Union government," he stated.

390.title: Sri Lanka creates 2 new ministries to deal with economic crisis
390.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has created two new ministries to deal with the severe economic crisis in the country. The Ministry of Technology and Investment Promotion was created to promote foreign direct investment (FDI) in the country. The Ministry of Women, Child Affairs and Social Empowerment includes 15 national institutions and departments, according to a local report.

391.title: Goldman Sachs CEO shares 5 tips for interns, includes 'Be an entrepreneur'
391.article_body: Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon shared some advice with the incoming interns at the global investment bank. In an email, Solomon advised the interns to "take the long view" and "be an entrepreneur". He asked them to "embrace evolution" and to listen and ask questions. "Make time to do things that you want to do because they...excite you," he added.

392.title: Stones pelted in UP's Prayagraj over Prophet remarks row, ADG's car damaged
392.article_body: Massive protests broke in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj on Friday against alleged inflammatory remarks on Prophet Muhammad by former BJP leaders. Police said people raised slogans and pelted stones in Atala area after the Friday prayers ended. The car of Prayagraj ADG, who was on the ground to take control of the law and order situation, was damaged during the protest.

393.title: Massive protests erupt across India over ex-BJP leaders' remarks on Prophet
393.article_body: Protests were held in Delhi and several other cities across India on Friday over ex-BJP leaders Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal's remarks on Prophet Muhammad. Protests and stone-pelting were reported in several cities of UP including Lucknow, Saharanpur, Moradabad and Prayagraj. West Bengal's Kolkata, Punjab's Ludhiana, Telangana's Hyderabad, Jharkhand's Ranchi and J&K's Srinagar also saw protests.

394.title: Andre Russell gifts himself Mercedes-Benz AMG GT R after IPL 2022, pics surface
394.article_body: West Indies and KKR all-rounder Andre Russell gifted himself a Mercedes-Benz AMG GT R sports car after IPL 2022. Pictures of Russell standing near his new buy have surfaced. Russell also shared a video, writing, "As a ghetto yute I always dream big! But with hard work and sacrifices, dreams become reality. God is good."

395.title: 28-year-old raped in 5-star hotel in Delhi's Dwarka by man she met on dating app
395.article_body: A 28-year-old woman has alleged that she was raped by a man, whom she met on a dating app, in a five-star hotel in Delhi's Dwarka area, the police said. DCP (Dwarka) M Harsha Vardhan said, "The accused did not answer her calls after that and she lodged an FIR against him. The accused is a resident of Hyderabad."

396.title: Scarlett Johansson to star in Kristin Scott Thomas' 'My Mother's Wedding'
396.article_body: Actress Scarlett Johansson has signed on to star in the upcoming film 'My Mother's Wedding'. The film will mark the feature directorial debut of Kristin Scott Thomas, who has co-written the script with John Micklethwait. According to Deadline, Sienna Miller, Emily Beecham and Freida Pinto will also feature in the movie produced by Finola Dwyer and Steven Rales.

397.title: EU Parliament firmly behind Ukraine’s candidacy bid: Prez Metsola
397.article_body: The European Union's Parliament "stands firmly" behind Ukraine's bid to achieve candidate status to join the European Union, the Parliament's President Roberta Metsola said. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in April completed the first step in obtaining European Union membership for Ukraine by submitting a questionnaire. Ukraine currently has an association agreement with the EU.

398.title: Nick Jonas attends Jimmy Fallon's show with kalawa on his wrist, fans react
398.article_body: Singer Nick Jonas recently attended 'The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon' where he was seen wearing kalawa, a sacred red thread, on his wrist. Reacting to a video of Nick shared by 'The Tonight Show' on their official Instagram handle, a user wrote, "Did someone notice he is wearing a rakhsha dhaga," while another commented, "Work of Priyanka (Chopra)."

399.title: BMC employee befriends woman on FB, rapes her promising financial help
399.article_body: A Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation employee was arrested for allegedly raping a married woman he befriended on Facebook. The woman alleged that the accused promised to help her and her husband with their debt and raped her at a lodge in Chembur. When she threatened to file a complaint, he called her again, promising to pay money but raped her again.

400.title: Ordinance soon on online rummy games, committee formed: TN Govt
400.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government has said that it will soon come up with an ordinance to corner online rummy and other card games. A committee headed by a retired judge has been constituted to look into the matter. Notably, the ordinance is being promulgated to tackle incidents of people ending their lives after losing money in the game.

401.title: Fire breaks out in carpet and crockery factory in Delhi's Hamidpur
401.article_body: A fire broke out in the godown of a carpet and crockery factory in Delhi's Hamidpur on Thursday evening and no casualties were reported, officials said. As many as 23 fire tenders were rushed to the spot to combat the fire. The NOC was not taken from the concerned department while establishing the factory, a Delhi Fire Service official said.

402.title: Today people talk about pan-India stars, I think I was one: Sonali Bendre
402.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre in an interview described herself as a "pan-India star" and added that she has never in her life been appreciated for her performances. "I was very successful in Hindi," she said. "I was very successful in Telugu, Tamil, Maratha, all sorts. So, today you talk about pan-India stars, I think I was one," Sonali further said.

403.title: Jasleen Royal pays tribute to KK by singing 'Yaaron' at concert, shares video
403.article_body: Singer Jasleen Royal paid tribute to late singer KK at one of her recent concerts. She took to Instagram to share a video where she could be seen singing KK's 'Yaaron' at the concert. "Remember singing this with...my school and college friends at the top of our voices...I salute you KK sir! You'll live on forever," Jasleen wrote.
